text: This unit is poor when fighting hand-to-hand. Try to keep it away from enemy formations.
This unit is highly skilled in parrying and dodging incoming melee attacks.
This unit causes extra damage against shielded enemies.
When fighting against heroes on the battlefield they will find their skills and prowess much improved.
This unit is unshielded and therefore has little defence against missile attacks.
Mounted archers use their impressive speed and manoeuvrability to stay out of reach of the enemy and encircle unprotected units.
This unit's training has reached a level where they can even deflect missiles without a shield!
This unit's missiles are heavily tipped to drill through the strongest armour, but will still be deflected by shields.
The weapons of this unit are coated in poison, inflicting lingering armour-ignoring damage on foes that are hit.
This unit is slower than others, meaning it can be outmanoeuvred and attacked in its vulnerable flanks.
This unit is only armoured with light cloth, making it vulnerable when engaged.
This unit excels at charging enemy frontlines, slaying all in their path.
This unit is terrifying to its foes and reduces the morale of nearby enemies.
These units have the advantage of being able to deploy behind enemy lines to strike at unexpecting targets.
Causes extra damage when knocking enemies back.
Best kept away from the fighting, this unit can bestow positive effects upon other units.
Heavy armour protects this unit from most damage, but armour-piercing weapons will still pose a threat to them.
Ordnance units excel at scything down enemies, particularly when on high ground and protected by infantry.
This unit is led by a person of great renown, who inspires the morale of those around them.
This unit's speed and mass will work against it if charging the pointy end of enemy spears!
This unit's weapons allow it to pierce even the strongest enemy armour.
This unit consists of few men, making them easily overwhelmed.
These soldiers are not disciplined enough to adopt advanced formations.
Individuals in this unit swing their weapons in a wide arc and are thus able to hit multiple foes at once.
This unit is trained to fight against mounted enemies.
A shielded and fast-moving unit that absorbs missile fire to charge into vulnerable missile units.
These units are strong against flanking units such as cavalry, so are best used to protect vulnerable flanks.
Elephants are large, fearsome beasts, able to plow through infantry and damage buildings and gates.
This unit will keep fighting even when others have already routed.
This unit has a ranged weapon that can soften up enemies before engaging in hand-to-hand combat.
These troops are best placed at the rear of an army, where they can cause damage from a position of relative safety.
Incredible tenacity and a sharp weapon make this infantry unit strong whilst charging.
Be it on the frontline, flanking, or when manning ordnance, this versatile unit excels in most positions.
This unit has powerful ranged attacks that can pierce armoured foes with ease.
This unit is very vulnerable to cavalry charges, especially to the flanks.
An inexpensive unit of easily replaced individuals that can be sacrificed for the greater cause.
Frontline units are tough and able to withstand a beating; they will hold to the end, while others around flee. They are also adept at charging into enemy frontline units.
This unit has an unshakable resolve and will fight to the bitter end.
This unit's heavy armour is no protection against armour-piercing weapons.
This unit will consistently cause low damage; it will therefore take time for them to deal with enemy units.
While the bow is this unit's primary weapon, it can also hold its own in melee.
This unit is highly skilled in melee and wears its enemies down through sustained hand-to-hand combat.
This unit is immune to fatigue, and will carry on fighting when others have succumbed to exhaustion.
An intimate knowledge of the land enables this unit to move freely across any terrain, whether that means fording rivers, navigating forests or traversing deserts.
This unit excels at destroying lightly-armoured enemies, raining death upon them from a safe distance.
These units cause untold damage to infrastructure by hurling heavy projectiles at enemy fortifications.
Raiders feel most at home in towns and villages, where they can use their torches for their favourite activity - burning things down!
These troops carry shields to protect them from incoming missiles, but offer little defence against artillery.
Fast, agile and devastating - flanking units can turn the tide of battle with a well-timed charge or by routing enemy missile units.
These units harry the enemy, slowing them down through the use of advanced tactics and weaponry.
Skirmishers serve to distract and soften up enemy troops, and are almost impossible to run down as they harass their targets.
This unit has a superior, devastating charge attack compared to other flanking units.
These soldiers obey only their own passions. They may charge without orders and act erratically on the battlefield!
Melee cavalry use their speed to outmanoeuvre their enemies, striking at exposed flanks and vulnerable units.
This unit has a number of animals under its control. Once unleashed these animals will bite, claw and maul enemies.
This unit is likely to flee quickly when it suffers casualties or is involved in a losing battle.
This unit's oil arrows spatter flame over their targets upon impact, causing devastation over a larger area.
This unit uses fire attacks to burn all those who come too close. Whether through conditioning or protective materials, this unit is resistant to fire damage.
